stdGYS statements

These statements are available in stdGYS:
  • return
  • if
  • for
  • while
  • do

return

return some_return_value
This statement finishes current script and sets its return value. It also can be used to return values from functions.

if

if(bool)
{
    [CODE]
}
else if(bool)
{
    [CODE]
}
else if(bool)
{
    [CODE]
} //...
else
{
    [CODE]
}
This control statement allows to execute a code if a condition is true and execute a different code otherwise.

Attention:
This statement doesn't have its own local scope.

for

for([init-CODE]; [bool cond]; [loop-CODE])
{
        [CODE]
}

The for loop executes a code and loop-code repeatedly until cond-expression becomes false. Use the for statement to construct loops that must execute a specified number of times.

Attention:
This statement doesn't have its own local scope.

while

while(bool cond)
{
    [CODE]
}

The while loop executes code repeatedly until cond-expression evaluates to zero.

Attention:
This statement doesn't have its own local scope.

do

do
{
    [CODE]
} 
while(bool cond)

The do-while statement executes a code repeatedly until the specified termination cond-expression evaluates to zero. The test of the termination condition is made after each execution of the loop; therefore, a do-while loop executes one or more times, depending on the value of the termination expression.

Attention:
This statement doesn't have its own local scope.
